definition: to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage

sentences.english: There was a roar of anger from his fellows: Scabior drew his wand.
sentences.chinese: 他的同伙们怒吼起来，斯卡比奥拔出魔杖。
透过狂风的呼啸和怒吼。

sentences.english: Hell for some time, full of murderous look will become more angry.
sentences.chinese: 地狱持续一段时间后，充满杀气的怒吼会变多。

sentences.english: The angry shouts of the demonstrators rent the air.
sentences.chinese: 示威群众的怒吼震天动地。

sentences.english: When Rhaegal roared, a gout of yellow flame turned darkness into day for half a heartbeat.
sentences.chinese: 当雷哥怒吼时，一瞬间一股黄焰将黑暗变成白昼。

sentences.english: It thunders and the wind rushes screaming through the void.
sentences.chinese: 雷声在响，狂风怒吼着穿过天空。

sentences.english: I vaguely remember snarling at someone who stepped on my foot.
sentences.chinese: 我隐约记得我曾向着那个踩了我一脚的人怒吼。

sentences.english: The wounded tigress was now roaring double tides.
sentences.chinese: 只受伤的母老虎正在怒吼。

sentences.english: A high wind blustered round the house, and roared in the chimney it sounded wild and stormy .
sentences.chinese: 大风绕屋咆哮，并在烟囱里怒吼，听起来狂暴猛烈。

sentences.english: The winds blew and the rains fell, as though heaven had opened its windows.
sentences.chinese: 狂风怒吼，暴雨如注，好像天上敞开了窗户。

sentences.english: The river came roaring toward Long Ju's army.
sentences.chinese: 河水怒吼着冲向龙且的军队。

sentences.english: Above was an angry sky, from which rain fell and in which lightning played.
sentences.chinese: 大山之上是怒吼的天空，大雨滂沱，雷电肆虐。

sentences.english: He gave out a mighty roar, but he could not escape.
sentences.chinese: 他发出威猛的怒吼声，却无法逃脱。

sentences.english: The piteous moan of reproach was drowned in the angry and menacing roar of the mob.
sentences.chinese: 责难的哀吟，淹没在人群雷霆怒吼之中。

sentences.english: They get what they want by bellowing and no fooling.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过怒吼和执着得到他们想要的东西。

sentences.english: That station the ghost ahead the body in the Qin Dynasty will, suddenly bring out the voice of a roars.
sentences.chinese: 那站在秦朝身前的鬼将，忽然发出一声怒吼之声。

definition: to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
to roar/to howl/to shriek/roar or howl of an animal/bellow of rage
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
